definition: to have a special fondness (for sth)
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
alone/independent/single/sole/only
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
surname Zhong
variant of 鍾|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: Antony goes for projects on a massive scale.
sentences.chinese: 南豐對大型項目情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: Bernstein took voiceover classes at night and loved it.
sentences.chinese: 她晚上去聽配音課，對配音事業情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: I have a soft spot for such ventures so Cahill starts out in the plus column with me.
sentences.chinese: 我有一個這樣的企業情有獨鍾，以便卡希爾在開。

sentences.english: Jerry eats candy bars everyday because he has a sweet tooth.
sentences.chinese: 傑瑞天天喫好幾條巧克力棒，因爲他對甜食情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: All previous dynasties writer literati are many to the peony has only one in mind, chants does not approve already.
sentences.chinese: 歷代文人墨客多對牡丹情有獨鍾，詠贊不已。

sentences.english: As an architect in the storage industry, I have an affinity to file systems.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一名存儲行業的架構師，我對文件系統情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: Huang Ying, the deputy leader of the Yangko troupe had a special affection for Yangko.
sentences.chinese: 秧歌隊副隊長黃英對秧歌情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: Do they have a fondness for fresh herbs?
sentences.chinese: 他們對新鮮的香草情有獨鍾麼？

sentences.english: But South Korea, like Japan, has a vibrant seafood culture.
sentences.chinese: 但是和日本一樣，韓國對海味也是情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: According to the author, many students understanding for network especially like pizza.
sentences.chinese: 據筆者瞭解，很多同學對於網絡情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: Your love for flower is unforgettable and your favourite is Chinese flowering crabapple.
sentences.chinese: 難忘的愛花之情，你卻對海棠情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: My dear little brother had eyes only for persimmon pies and he was too anxious to wait for the porridge.
sentences.chinese: 我親愛的小弟弟對柿餅情有獨鍾，已經等不及煮粥了。

sentences.english: Being in especial love of Song poems, Mr.
sentences.chinese: 錢先生對宋詩情有獨鍾，有《宋詩選注》在焉。
我對耳環一直情有獨鍾。

sentences.english: That's because young people especially like pizza .
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲年輕人對它情有獨鍾。

definition: to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
as everyone knows (idiom)
countless changes/constant permutation
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to skim (through a book)/to read cursorily/to dip into
in great abundance/numerous
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to shrink back/to flinch
simple and unadorned/plain/(of land) level/even
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
advanced guard/vanguard/avant-garde/forward (soccer position)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
